At a dinner this week, attended by "The Daily Telegraph" , with conservatives in New York, Donald Rumsfeld elicited murmurs of approval when he suggested that Barack Obama 's troop-heavy strategy in Afghanistan was flawed. I personally did not think we needed to make a career out of Afghanistan, he said. "The Soviets were in there with hundreds of thousands of troops for 12 years and lost. It's a landlocked country, it went through occupation, civil war, drought, hostile neighbours.

the US and admits it took a discussion with an unnamed "successful" friends to make him realise it was time to go. He explained on a forthcoming episode of` Oprah Presents Master Class': I asked a very successful guy,` What's the best advice you can give me?' and he said,` Simon Cowell , always know when to leave the fair.' And I think that's good advice. Something inside you just says,` You know what, it's time to go.' Without any regrets whatsoever. American Idol', Simon Cowell - who got engaged to make-up artist Mezhgan Hussainy last year- insists he has enjoyed being a TV talent show judge because it isn't very difficult.
